General.name: Curtin University
General.about: Curtin University is an innovative, global university established in 1986 (originally founded as the Western Australian Institute of Technology in 1966). Known for high-impact research and strong industry networks, Curtin ranks among the top 1% of universities worldwide and is affiliated with the Australian Technology Network. The university has 5 campuses in Australia and 4 international campuses in Dubai, Malaysia, Singapore, and Mauritius.
General.admission_requirements: Application Process: Visit the official website and click 'Apply Now', complete education history, employment history, and personal statement, then submit with required fees. Documents Required: Official academic transcripts, passport photos, passport copy, visa, updated CV/Resume, English Language Proficiency Test Scores, Letters of Recommendation, and Statement of Purpose.

FAQs.question: How many intakes does each course have per year?
FAQs.answer: Most courses at Curtin have intakes in Semester 1 and/or Semester 2. Intakes are typically in February for the beginning of semester one, and July for the beginning of semester two. However, not all courses will have intakes for both.

FAQs.question: What is the difference between a single and a double major?
FAQs.answer: A single major concentrates on one area of specialization, whilst a double major focuses on two areas of specialization. A double major will allow a student to complete study in those two separate areas under the same award.

FAQs.question: What is the open day?
FAQs.answer: Curtin Open Day is one of the biggest events on the Curtin calendar and usually takes place on a Sunday. It provides a great opportunity for prospective students, their families, and friends to come to Curtin University to experience the innovative learning activities that the University offers.

FAQs.question: Does Curtin offer scholarships?
FAQs.answer: Yes, Curtin offers a range of scholarships to students. Scholarships are available for both commencing and current Curtin students.

FAQs.question: How much time will I have to allocate to studying?
FAQs.answer: Students can expect that for every 1 hour of class time, they will put in 1 hour of additional study. As a full-time student, you can expect up to 30 hours of work per week, but this can vary as there may be busier periods when the workload is very demanding and other times when the load is somewhat reduced.

FAQs.question: Is Curtin a good university?
FAQs.answer: Curtin is globally recognized for its strong connections with industry, high-impact research and a wide range of innovative courses. In recent years, the University has established itself among the top one per cent of universities in the world (ARWU 2021).

FAQs.question: What does Curtin University Specialise in?
FAQs.answer: Curtin leads major national or international research projects in minerals and energy, data analytics, sustainable development, health sciences, agriculture and astronomy.

FAQs.question: Who are some famous alumni of Curtin University?
FAQs.answer: Curtin University has also had a long list of notable alumni like Judy Davis (Australian actress), Cody Fem (Australia Actor and Director), John Butler (Musician), Natalia Cooper (Journalist for Nine News at the Nine Network Sydney), Jessica De Gouw (Actress), and many more.

FAQs.question: How many international students are present in Curtin University?
FAQs.answer: Curtin University enrols more than 13,000 International students every year which comprise more than 25% of its overall student body. Students from more than 100 countries study at Curtin University.

Visas.name: Student Visa (Subclass 500)
Visas.describe: The Student visa (subclass 500) allows you to remain in Australia for the duration of your study. This visa allows you to study full-time in Australia at a registered educational institution, bring eligible family members to Australia, and work up to 48 hours per fortnight while studying.

Visas.name: Temporary Graduate Visa (Subclass 485)
Visas.describe: The Temporary Graduate visa allows international students who have recently graduated from an Australian educational institution to remain in Australia temporarily to gain work experience. This visa has two streams: Graduate Work stream and Post-Study Work stream, with varying duration based on qualifications.
